Summary: Very bright, mirror like, skewed rectangle streaking across the horizon
divs: Sighting DetailsWas leaving a small neighborhood on the north side of Hugo Oklahoma. The area is open with no trees. Heading south I saw a very bright object to the west-south-west, about 20 degrees above the horizon. It appeared to be moving north, and was getting lower on the horizon as it moved. It moved from the approximate wsw position in the sky to a westerly position in about 20 seconds. The object was the shape of a skewed rectangle, about a third as high as it was long. It took up approximately an inch of sky at arms length. It was very bright, like a mirror shining in the sun, and did not put off a trail or sparks as with a meteor. I traveled at most 100 yards to the end of the road, and lost sight of it due to trees at the end of this road. I headed west toward home and attempted to catch sight of it again, but did not.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Hugo
This sighting has never been favorited.
